title: Great Functionality - Fridge Temperature Monitoring
text:
With a child that requires refrigerated medicine for his condition, we needed something to monitor refrigerator temperature and notify us if out of specified range. (We lost 2 doses of medicine due to refrigerator issue and also power outage while we were away).

This product constantly and accurately reports temp and also reports if it cannot communicate with wireless router via text, app notification, email, etc. Other functionality is available but we use as noted above as primary purpose.

title: room for improvement
text:
Not as much customization as i thought there would be. Light sensor will not change from 30 second update. Doesnt seem to be any way to actually force the sensors to report at and only at the intervals i want them to. “Turning off” things like temp or humidity doesn't actually turn it off. Not very many kumo apps to choose from. Especially light sensor related. Iv searched everywhere for help on writing my own but so far can not find anything close to any kind of tutorial or anything showing even basic commands or how to use them. Tried using a java checker but even working apps throw errors as far as normal java is concerned i guess. So im not sure how to go about learning.
I am making due and getting done basically what i need done, but with help of manual timers in conjunction with this system. So, nice work on all this and i really hope to see improvement

title: Solid Hardware
text:
The sensors have needed little maintenance. I keep a pile of batteries just in case. Using them to track the heat cycles of an old steam  heating system. 

My only wish would be for better integrations - HomeKit would be great to then control fans and a/c depending on the temperature.

Otherwise I’m happy! Thank you

title: Great product
text: I installed a wireless sensor tag on my wood boiler and it works great especially when we go ice fishing for a long weekend. All I have to do is open up the app and see the temperature chart and that lets me know if I need to have someone put wood in.

title: Geeky interface but awesome product…
text: Reported app issue with update and was fixed within a few hours! Thank you

title: Last update issues—Trends freeze
text: This rating is for last update. Following the most recent update when swiping to the trends screen causes the iOS app to freeze on a blank screen. Closing the app does not reset. App must be deleted and reinstalled. Overall this is a robust app that has evolved well since 2012, Look forward to the developers fixing this bug. Thanks!

title: Terrific!
text:
Wireless tags are terrific. They provide me with the remote access to temperature humidity status. The app is simple and quite functional and interfaces with my WEMO and Nest devices. Great Application.

Only negative is battery usage…

title: Excellent monitor
text: I have been using this for 4 years.  The monitor has worked flawlessly.   I plan to add more in the future.

title: Decent app. UI could be more refined.
text: App is functional and provides good customization features. Would like a better look / feel and ability to look at Events by sensor in the widget settings for iOS.

title: Great
text: Peace of mind knowing the beautiful fish I've caught is frozen and will stay that way till I'm ready to enjoy. An alert if power or freezer fails and while I'm gone and I can have a friend bring ice... Lots of ice!

title: A few bugs
text: Overall very good design, a few small bugs that I hope they fix.

title: Best of what is available.
text: I have used 4 different products to monitor temps on the farm this is the best by far. Product, quality, app, info resolution.

title: Amazing for Parents!
text:
We're using these to monitor the temperature in our kids' bedrooms. With temps so high here in Texas in the summer, the app has notified us when the temp got up to 80 degrees Fahrenheit and we needed to lower the AC. It's comforting to know we have an alert for the possibility of the AC failing. 

We also have a tag in the freezer. Our fridge is getting older and the appliance guy let us know the whirring motor may be near the end of its life. With our freezer full of breast milk, I feel better knowing the tag will alert us if it dies overnight. It's already pinged us for leaving the door open too long while loading groceries. 

We're barely scratching the surface of their functionality, and already they have been so helpful.

title: Useful Tool
text: I like the value and flexibility of the Wireless Tag products. The App is useful, but occasionally the interface can be a little clunky.

title: Outdoor probe
text: Great solution to monitor hot tub temperatures. The battery monitor in this device is strange however as a new battery, checked with a digital meter the system indicated 2.34 v?

title: Out of range alert does not work
text: I set the alert using the settings cog, set it to email and push notify, but i got no alert and my dog escaped and once again had to find him at a neighbor’s house.

title: Great product
text:
Edit April 2017, developers are releasing new features fairly often and my sensors are working with relatively little issues. Still happy with the system!

If you like data and smart home automation...this app and the sensors are great for just that!

Edit June 2016: my review below was answered VERY quickly. The developers added every detail that I requested. I am very happy and appreciate the responsiveness!

My next request is for additional smart control products to be supported such as the TP link wifi switches. Also I would like to see a waterproof reed sensor and PIR sensor.

April 2016:
Looking for a new feature to be added. I would like the ability to swipe on a notification on the lock screen and a "pause for an hour" button appears. Ideally the time frame could be configurable for each sensor. Also this button should be available on the Apple Watch when the notification appears there. Also another button (I believe you can do two) to disarm the sensor for a configurable amount of Time as well. This way I can stop notifications if I am in/out of the back door, during a specific time period or disarm the tag from affecting other smart items in the house.

I really hope this is a feasible feature that can be added.

Thanks

title: Working well
text: I bought two 13 bit tags to monitor temperature. To calibrate I put them in a plastic bag and dunked them in ice slush. Took them 30 minutes to stabilize at near 32. I set them both the same at 32.6 because figured that was probably right for my setup. Ice point is hard to get to 32 outside of a lab. They adjust to rising temperatures much quicker than falling temperatures. Between 40 to 75 degrees they agree within 1/2 degree with each other and within 1-1/2 degrees of two low cost electronic thermometers. That is very good.  After 3 weeks batteries still above 93%. Looking forward to using the Kumo app features. Humidity seems to track with my Nest. I haven't tested motion. The app is OK for my use but I think most people would find it confusing to set the tags up. But then the app and tags are a bit beyond the average person's needs.

title: Great app &  system
text: I use this to moniter my house when I travel abroud, because a while ago my water heater started to leak. Luckily I caught the leak a couple of minutes after it started, limiting the damage. Because of that, I use this system to warn me, when I'm not home. It is also very reasonable priced, when you compare a 20$ sensor to 100s if not 1000s of dollars of damage, it makes it worth it. I also enjoy the long battery life. The app does logout after a while, and it doesn't offer email support which would be nice, so if an alarm is triggered you would be pushed an email no matter whether you have the app open or not. Also, it would be nice to have customizable alerts sound. Overall it makes me feel safe to leave my house, confident it'll be the same when I come back.

title: Great Product for Techies
text: These sensors are great for folks who are technically inclined to use for a variety of purposes. They can be used to track the opening/closing of doors, motion, temperature, and humidity.  They can be linked with the Nest thermostat (for example) and used as an alternative source of the room temperature used to turn on/off the heat/air. The app interface is a little tough to navigate at first, but it can be figured out. I use these on doors throughout my home so I know when they open/close. I really enjoy this product.

title: Nicely customizable app for tracking temperature changes
text:
I had a small bit of trouble initially because of needing to open a port on my AirPort Extreme, but once I did that the wireless tags worked perfectly.

The app itself is a little busy, but that's because it offers numerous customization options. I particularly appreciate the push notifications for when a sensor's temperature goes above or below a preset number, and the temperature graphs over time are also extremely useful.

title: TEMPERATURE MONITOR
text: I glued a temperature monitor tag into my refrigerator.  Now we can check the fridge's status anytime we want.  If the temp or humidity goes out of range at any time we will be notified. We once had a refrigerator fail when we were away on a long trip.  Even though we had it repaired the smells could never be removed and the fridge had to be replaced.  Now when we are away we can alert friends if the fridge is opened or if it malfunctions.  It connected to my WIFI network quite easily.

title: Great app!
text:
I've been very happy with this app and it's sensors. I personally like it because you can get quick charts of temp, humidity, etc. You can also download all of the data. We've used them to figure out the best way to cool off our house without using AC.

Update: Our heater died this winter so we used these to monitor the temperatures of our kids bedrooms. It helped us toon our use of space heaters while waiting for the full repair. Lifesaver!

title: Non-existent support - avoid
text:
I purchased this product and had high hopes for it. When I received it there was a problem. The label on the receiver ripped rendering the serial number unreadable. Without the serial number you can't use the device. The serial number isn't written anywhere else (not on the box, not on the manual, not on the registration card, not in the email). For something as important, you would think it would appear in more than one place!

This problem is compounded by the fact that when I called them (during business hours) I got a recording saying it was after business hours. I called again the next day, earlier, and was told nobody was available and to fill out a support ticket online. The problem… the website won't let me create a support ticket!

I sent two emails to customer service (which the phone recording said would be responded to within one business day). So far I've heard nothing!

In short, a worthless product and nonexistent support. I will be returning the product shortly.

title: Nothing like it anywhere.
text: This is a highly advanced temperature, motion, light, humidity and plant moisture monitoring system that actually works.  The wireless tags are affordable and easy to set up.  Nothing comes close for the quality of the system. Amazingly the tags work inside refrigerators wirelessly over 60 feet away, which I've never seen with any affordable system.

title: Pretty amazing
text:
Just received my Ethernet Tag Manager and Wireless Motion Sensor Tags today.  Downloaded the app, and started the enjoying the product right away.  Pretty easy to set up, and the devices seem to send notifications about 90% off the time.  Still tweaking the settings - and may have to move the Tag Manager away from my WiFi router.  The Temp Graph doesn't give a graph but the option to download a CSV file - might be an iOS 6 thing...

All in all this looks like a great app and hardware solution.

title: Great App, only minor annoyances
text: Everything about this app is great, except the alerts are queued annoyingly. If you don't open the app after each alert, and you get several alerts (door open/close, temperature out of range, phone enter/leave area, etc), you are greeted with the audio from each alert all at once. Awesome. Other than that, the app is great. The logging/graphing is awesome for identifying trends, and installing/disabling kumoapps is a snap.

title: So many application!
text: Very flexible sensors that can be used for so many applications.  I've started making dumb things smart! Place the ambient light sensor over an indicator light and all of the sudden, something that was a closed system with no connectivity is talking to the IOT. Just getting started with all the possibilities at home and at work!

title: Awesome!
text: This is the best way ever to monitor your freezer! Love these things. We've lost the freezer contents 3 times in the last 2 years because the door was left open! This little device makes me confident I know when something isn't going right. I'm ordering more to watch for water were it shouldn't be!

title: Great concept, clunky app
text: I want to love this product, really I do.  The concept is amazing, the tags are inexpensive and super simple to install and set up.  But the app is just painful to use.  It's got a lot of features, too many features in fact, but it doesn't do any of them especially well.  The UI is awful, like "is this button showing me the light is on or letting me turn it on?".  With a little polish this could be such a fabulous app, it makes me want to cry every time I use it.

title: Great tags
text: Excellent product. Very convenient to use. We use them all around the house to keep up with temperatures inside, out and humidity and temperature in the crawlspace. Status of garage door open or closed. Graphs are great to track status over time. Easy to download stats to use in other programs.

title: Suits me! Great app
text: Main use is was to monitor 3 fridges. Had fridge door left open 2 years ago and had to trash so many items. Then found tags and sleep better now. Have over stock fridges in basement. Alerts me door open or closed and current temp. I have now added to front and back doors of house!

title: Perfect for what I needed
text: I needed to track the temp in my attic to make sure my venting was working correctly. I bought the 5 pack of sensors to also monitor the outside temp and some rooms in the house. This app gave me tons of great data to work with and showed some interesting trends overall!

title: Great technology
text: UI Does need help, but only because there's a lot you can do and it's all crammed into a few screens. It's clearly an interface developed by and for engineers. Some options are still only available on the web interface. Or maybe I just can't find the option to clear all graph data on my iPad...

title: Great app and system!
text: We have integrated Wireless tags all over our home and so far they are working great. Being able to coordinate different systems to make the house easier to manage has been fantastic. Keep up the great work!

title: Great app
text: App is excellent. Sensors are perfect. The only thing I had during installation, that tag manager is low on signal strength if you use metal refrigerators. Doesn't make any difference if you are using narrow or wide band. But with Wi-Fi it's obvious. Be prepared to use more tag managers for professional environment.

title: Very nice app
text: This lets me monitor temperatures from home over the weekend, so that I don't have to drive 25 minutes to work. The features are well organized and comprehensive, without getting too cumbersome. Overall, highly recommended.

title: Wireless Tags are an effective system to monitor your home
text: This app allows the users to find temperature, humidity, movement and light measurements. The system and the app work well and easily provide a manner to find what's going on at home. The app is intuitive and effective.

title: Great
text: I love all the features and things one can do with the tags and the app.  I have had no problems with it.  I only wish they made a tag that had voltage measuring input, I can think of lots applications for one. Three wires, Gng, Vin and Vref out, all protected against shorts, etc.

title: Nana is warm now
text: I use tags in combination with Nest thermostats to control the temperature using two furnaces in my mother's large old house in Indiana.  I do this from New York City.  She was cool all last summer and warm this winter, and her energy bills went down.  Love these tags.  Good value for the money, absolutely.

title: Useful
text: I use these in a workplace to ensure that refrigerator temperatures don't drop below a threshold, plus I have temperture logs, very useful.  Owned for about 2 years and holding up nicely even after battery changes (which last about a year CR 2032).

title: Overall very stable.
text: I'm currently using 9 tags, some running since Feb 2014. Cloud service downtime is much less than 1%.  Still room for improvement, but I continue to expand my network of sensors.

title: Awesome tech gadget
text: Those is my first review... I'm writing it because I think this app and the sensors are so much better than you would expect give their price... I really love it and I'm going to buy more as a gift for my dad!!

title: Humidor hero!!
text: This is a great product and the app is great also! I have 5 tags monitoring a wineador and a large humidor. I travel for work & it's great knowing I can monitor my cigars environment. It's reassuring to know my collection is safe while I'm a 1,000 miles away!

title: Best little gadgets ever
text: I have one on my garage door, underground in my irrigation value box, cigar humidor and IR sensor on my back patio. They all talk to my Insteon automation system so I get text messages and light control based on the condition of the tags. Very cool. My favorite automation sensors.

title: Works great with the temperature / humidity tracking
text: Wanted to track the temperature and humidity in a number of rooms in my house and see the trend over the winter while using a wood stove to heat the house.  So far, very happy with the monitors and the app.

title: Not that great
text: Great idea but poor implementation. I got 6 tags including 3 magnetic sensors.    After one hour of all the tags sitting together on my kitchen table, there are about 4 degrees diference between all tags!! To me this is a big deal and real problem. I calibrated the sensors by they drift over time. As for the app it does not work on my 3GS 6.1 , it crashes after opening. Not worth the almost 300$ I spent.

title: Reliable system
text:
The sensors and app just keep working. No issues. Very reliable in a remote cabin over the last 6 months. Using to monitor freezer temp, inside temp, inside motion (breakin), and outside temp. 
Highly recommended.

title: Great Iphone app with constant improvement.
text: I've been using this app since it came out and the developers are constantly improving it. I give it 5 stars without hesitation.

title: Kumostat not WirelessTag?
text:
First the app installed is titled and runs as Kumostat and not the WirelessTag named here. Is that allowed as part of the Apple App Store policy?

Second none of the five tags I ordered work with Kumostat as described in the web site for the product. Two of them failed to communicate with the app, one communicates but will not notify me of any motion and one other the battery was sucked dry in a week.

I emailed support five days ago and gotten no reply.

title: Outstanding App for Outstanding Products!
text: Feature rich app to track multiple parameters on WirelessTag sensors.  The app allows for very simple product setup and tracking.  Easily integrates with IFTTT to trigger WEMO / Caseta / Wink / ZWave / other products.

title: Exactly what I was looking for
text: I have five temperature tags in greenhouses, a livestock building, and a walk in cooler. It was easy to set up and the temperatures are really easy to check with the app or online.

title: Works Great
text: Current release fixed the constant crashes I was having.  Overall, the app and the "Generation 2” sensors and manager have been working great. Good job!

title: Not the best ui but very reliable
text: App can be a bit hard to navigate but been using the tags very reliably for several months now and would recommend them. Support team is great too.

title: Great app. Reliable.  Easy
text: I monitor 5 settings in a vacation home 400 miles away in the cold.   I can pull up temps inside and out anytime.  Also monitor for leaks and intruders.   Amazing product.

title: Tags are ok software is pretty bad
text: I've had a couple tags for a year. The tags themselves are pretty neat. The software is nearly incomprehensible. It's like a test tool for tags. I'm an engineer and it takes me an hour to set them back up when the batteries in the tags die. It's been beta quality for too long.

title: Just great and works
text: They really do not have any competition on the market. Great products they allow me to complete my home automation projects.

title: Great app, great service
text: I use the wireless tags and this app to keep an eye on temps in my house when I'm not home. No monthly charges and alerts if something goes wrong - perfect!

title: Impressive
text: I continue to find new uses and new ways to use my wireless sensor tags. I'm very impressed by their solution. I'd recommend them to anyone that likes to tinker.

title: Best of the best
text: For the do it yourself folks ... NO better option ... Your own creativity  is the only limit to the usage possibilities

title: Great Product!
text: Has saved us much time and effort monitoring cooler temps remotely.   So much better than what we had before.

title: Excellent product
text: Easy setup, simple inexpensive security system.  I have gotten a few fake notifications, but still tweaking the setting on the tags.

title: Does what I expected
text: And cheaper and less buggy than other systems and apps.

title: Keep track of your environment
text: Great app to keep track of temperature etc. in remote locations or at home

title: Cool beans
text: Really like these on my garage doors, reminds me to close them when I forget or alerts me if they open unexpectedly.

title: Wireless Tag Sensors
text: After working with the tags, monitor, and sensors, trying different things and learning their behavior, they work great.

title: Back and forth on stability
text:
You never know what you are going to get with each version.  It appears we are back to yet another unstable release.  Whether it is the app, firmware or tags, who knows... Tags that once appeared can no long be found - even though they may be sitting 1 ft. from the Tag Manager.

Ughhh!

title: Works perfect on my farm
text: I monitor our duck house and shop using Wireless Tags. They work flawlessly. Perfect remote monitoring solution.

title: Nice App
text: App works well but some things like the time changes and setup are difficult to understand and setup

title: Great app!
text: More features than I imagined. The service links with Nest which was a nice plus.

title: Fails to send emails accurately
text: Installed three door/motion tags. Tried several angular settings (9 degrees to 55 degrees). Get a door open/closed email about 10 percent of the time. Sometimes it senses the door is open even when it is closed. Most of the time, it doesn't sense any door movement at all.

title: Good app but it needs improvements
text: App keeps quitting and navigation through the options and graphics can be improved

title: Works very well
text: Typically works very well for my needs. Support was nonresponsive to requests, and not all features are user-friendly (e.g., moisture sensor detection settings).

title: Good, not perfect
text: Example: the latest update forces the screen size to be that of the iPhone 4. Looks pretty poor in an iPhone 5.

title: Outstanding products!
text:
I purchased the small multi- sensors to monitor temp/humidity/motion in my acoustic guitar collection. The tags are so small and light, I'm able to install them inside the guitar, with no concerns. 

They are working great! 

I've since purchased reed and pir sensors for other purposes. I am a fan!

Ed Minyard

title: Decent sensor
text: I had had to calibrate the sensor several times since installation but it keeps a fairly decent tracking of room temp within my daughters room.

title: Great product
text: Products work flawlessly.  I use to monitor temp and humidity in wine cellar.  App has great monitoring tools and alarms.

title: Powerful
text: These tags are very configurable and work well for motion and temp/humidity. The app works very well

title: Amazing
text: The app and the sensors are amazing!  I've not seen anything else that can compare.

title: Remote boat temp monitoring
text: Been using these sensors for the past couple years and they work great. Love the temp graphs.

title: Flawless so far
text: Use these to monitor greenhouse and outdoor temp and humidity. Statistics and graphing are great. Getting more tags soon.

title: Excellent monitor
text: Very intuitive.  Works just like it should.

title: Great device
text: This is just what I needed. Works well.

title: Great updates
text: Information at your finger tips is fantastic

title: Excellent, useful, high tech gadgets!
text: Very happy with performance and offered functionality. IFTTT support rocks.

title: Works
text: One of the better smart home sensor solutions

title: Great app but dropped Watch app
text: What happened to the Apple Watch support ?  I depended on it and want it back, please. Love the app otherwise.

title: Great gadget
text: Fantastic product with huge applications for research

title: Wireless Tags
text: It works. Wish they would increase the font size on the graphs.

title: Chart text is way too tiny
text: Works great for alerts. Text on graphs is very hard to read, microscopic grey text on white.

title: Works great!
text: Helps me monitor temperatures in our buildings.

title: Lots if potential, why is calibration required?
text: Easy to set up, uses thermocouple wire so calibration seams meaningless and does not appear to make a difference.  Simplify this feature.

title: Works well
text: Awesome features!

title: Great app
text: Works very well.

title: Needs update
text:
Cool devices. App crashes a lot. Needs a lot of improvement.

App say I have 3 water sensors when I only have linked one to the app.

title: Good app
text: The actual Tiles are finicky, but once you get them working, the app works fine.

userName: Does not wish to give their name
title: Poor usability
text: The usability of the app could use a review. It's a shame, because it's a powerful concept, but the app usability it seriously lacking.

title: Good product
text: Works as advertised. Happy with it.

title: Not ready for prime time
text: Does not work with Nest in the least!! Do not buy the equipment or use the app expecting it to work the way the company is professing it does. Disgrace!

title: Wirelesstsgs are great
text: Easy setup and nice app.  These tags work very well.

title: Awesome app!
text: Excellent for monitoring cigar temp and humidity

title: Good idea bad implement.
text:
Try to love it.
But does not work as the setting for sound what I want it.

title: Avoid
text: Terrible user interface.

title: Crap
text: Run don't walk away from this

title: Awesome!!!
text: Really love this. Works great with WeMo.

title: Great!
text: Great app! Great platform!

title: Error connecting to server.
text: This app useless.

title: Excelent !
text: Great app !

title: Useful and easy
text:
These wireless tags are really handy. 
It was easy to get all my doors and gates set up for monitoring. Next I'm going to put one on the mailbox in a weather proof plastic box. 
I've had questions and got replies promptly. 
It's easy to customize behaviors using their free server, too. And easy to customize their interface using their code on your own web server. 
I hope their moisture sensors will be in stock soon.

title: Pierde señal
text: Pierde señal.  No se conecta después de varios días

title: Ok, some bugs
text:
This app does what it is supposed to do, for the most part. The app allows for the user to view a lot of data that is very helpful.There are a few drawbacks:

1. Under “Event History” it does not show the right temperature for each “Too hot” or “Too cold” event. Instead of showing the temperature at the time of the event, it just shows 92 degrees F. My alerts go off when it gets to 80 degrees F, so it is not accurate.

2. The “sub-apps” that are used to further control the main app sometimes shut themselves off. This is not ideal as the app can be used to monitor critical processes. 

3. The intervals at which a tag sends data to the receiver can not be changed from the app (I have not been able to). Must use online site.

title: User
text: I had several of these tags. The customer support was very poor. Instead we were told that they sell these tags with no intention to support them. The engineer's wife event sent nasty emails. They refused to replace faulty tags. After filing cases with Paypal, BBB and Amazon, they finally refunded our money. There are better solutions out there. Beware.
